alert.note: Alert for Traverse (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 15 at 11:20AM CDT until April 17 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM CDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...A portion of west central Minnesota, including the following county, Traverse. * WHEN...Until 745 PM CDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Several structures are flooded and some sand bagging operations are continuing. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1117 AM CDT, emergency management continued to report widespread flooding from snowmelt in the warned area due to snow melt. Flooding is already occurring, with numerous county and township roads barricaded due to flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Wheaton, Browns Valley, Dumont, Tintah, Mud Lake Landing, Collis, Silver Bridge, Immanuel Church, Siloah Country Church, Halls Landing, Trinity Lutheran Country Church, Rainbow Island, Lake Traverse, Traverse Country Park and northeastern Lake Traverse Reservation. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
